question:
Of the eight students—George, Helen, Irving, Kyle, Lenore, Nina, Olivia, and Robert—in a seminar, exactly six will give individual oral reports during three consecutive days—Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday. Exactly two reports will be given each day—one in the morning and one in the afternoon—according to the following conditions: Tuesday is the only day on which George can give a report. Neither Olivia nor Robert can give an afternoon report. If Nina gives a report, then on the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports, unless Nina's report is given on Wednesday.

Which one of the following could be the schedule of the students' reports?
A) Mon. morning: Helen; Mon. afternoon: Robert Tues. morning: Olivia; Tues. afternoon: Irving Wed. morning: Lenore; Wed. afternoon: Kyle
B) Mon. morning: Irving; Mon. afternoon: Olivia Tues. morning: Helen; Tues. afternoon: Kyle Wed. morning: Nina; Wed. afternoon: Lenore
C) Mon. morning: Lenore; Mon. afternoon: Helen Tues. morning: George; Tues. afternoon: Kyle Wed. morning: Robert; Wed. afternoon: Irving
D) Mon. morning: Nina; Mon. afternoon: Helen Tues. morning: Robert; Tues. afternoon: Irving Wed. morning: Olivia; Wed. afternoon: Lenore
E) Mon. morning: Olivia; Mon. afternoon: Nina Tues. morning: Irving; Tues. afternoon: Helen Wed. morning: Kyle; Wed. afternoon: George
chain_of_thought: We know George can only give a report on Tuesday. We also know that Olivia and Robert can’t give afternoon reports. If Nina gives a report, then on the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports. Nina giving a report means that on Wednesday, Lenore, Kyle, and Robert must give reports.  So we can deduce the schedule based on these conditions.
full_output:
<think>We know George can only give a report on Tuesday. We also know that Olivia and Robert can’t give afternoon reports. If Nina gives a report, then on the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports. Nina giving a report means that on Wednesday, Lenore, Kyle, and Robert must give reports.  So we can deduce the schedule based on these conditions.</think>
<ans>C</ans>

question:
Of the eight students—George, Helen, Irving, Kyle, Lenore, Nina, Olivia, and Robert—in a seminar, exactly six will give individual oral reports during three consecutive days—Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday. Exactly two reports will be given each day—one in the morning and one in the afternoon—according to the following conditions: Tuesday is the only day on which George can give a report. Neither Olivia nor Robert can give an afternoon report. If Nina gives a report, then on the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports, unless Nina's report is given on Wednesday.

If Kyle and Lenore do not give reports, then the morning reports on Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday, respectively, could be given by
A) Helen, George, and Nina
B) Irving, Robert, and Helen
C) Nina, Helen, and Olivia
D) Olivia, Robert, and Irving
E) Robert, George, and Helen
chain_of_thought: George can only give a report on Tuesday.  Nina can give a report on Monday or Wednesday, and if she gives a report on Monday, then Helen and Irving must give reports on the next day.  Since Olivia and Robert cannot give afternoon reports, the only option that satisfies all conditions is C.
full_output:
<think>George can only give a report on Tuesday.  Nina can give a report on Monday or Wednesday, and if she gives a report on Monday, then Helen and Irving must give reports on the next day.  Since Olivia and Robert cannot give afternoon reports, the only option that satisfies all conditions is C.</think>
<ans>C</ans>

question:

Exactly two reports will be given each day—one in the morning and one in the afternoon—according to the following conditions: Tuesday is the only day on which George can give a report. Neither Olivia nor Robert can give an afternoon report. If Nina gives a report, then on the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports, unless Nina's report is given on Wednesday.

Which one of the following is a pair of students who, if they give reports on the same day as each other, must give reports on Wednesday?
A) George and Lenore
B) Helen and Nina
C) Irving and Robert
D) Kyle and Nina
E) Olivia and Kyle
chain_of_thought: Nina's report on Wednesday will require Irving and Helen to give reports the next day. George can only give a report on Tuesday, so if Nina gives a report, Irving and Helen must give reports the next day. If Nina gives a report on Tuesday, then Irving and Helen must give reports on Wednesday, so we need to check if that is possible.
full_output:
<think>Nina's report on Wednesday will require Irving and Helen to give reports the next day. George can only give a report on Tuesday, so if Nina gives a report, Irving and Helen must give reports the next day. If Nina gives a report on Tuesday, then Irving and Helen must give reports on Wednesday, so we need to check if that is possible.</think>
<ans>B</ans>

If George, Nina, and Robert give reports and they do so on different days from one another, which one of the following could be true?
A) Helen gives a report on Wednesday.
B) Nina gives a report on Monday.
C) Nina gives a report on Tuesday.
D) Olivia gives a report on Monday.
E) Robert gives a report on Wednesday.

George can't give a report on Tuesday, and neither Olivia nor Robert can give an afternoon report. Nina giving a report, followed by Helen and Irving on the next day, is a possibility. Nina giving a report on Monday is a possibility. If Nina is on Tuesday, then it is a possibility that Helen and Irving give reports.  All of these possibilities are possible if Nina gives a report on Monday.
full_output:
<think>We need to find a scenario where George, Nina, and Robert give reports on different days. George can't give a report on Tuesday, and neither Olivia nor Robert can give an afternoon report. Nina giving a report, followed by Helen and Irving on the next day, is a possibility. Nina giving a report on Monday is a possibility. If Nina is on Tuesday, then it is a possibility that Helen and Irving give reports.  All of these possibilities are possible if Nina gives a report on Monday.</think>
<ans>C</ans>

question:
Of the eight students—George, Helen, Irving, Kyle, Lenore, Nina, Olivia, and Robert—in a seminar, exactly six will give individual oral reports during three consecutive days—Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday. Exactly two reports will be given each day—one in the morning and one in the afternoon—according to the following conditions: Tuesday is the only day on which George can give a report. Neither Olivia nor Robert can give an afternoon report. If Nina gives a report, then on the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports, unless Nina's report is given on Wednesday.

If Kyle gives the afternoon report on Tuesday, and Helen gives the afternoon report on Wednesday, which one of the following could be the list of the students who give the morning reports on Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday, respectively?
A) Irving, Lenore, and Nina
B) Lenore, George, and Irving
C) Nina, Irving, and Lenore
D) Robert, George, and Irving
E) Robert, Irving, and Lenore
chain_of_thought: Kyle giving the afternoon report on Tuesday means that Nina and Robert cannot give an afternoon report. If Nina gives a report, Helen and Irving must both give reports on the next day. George can only give a report on Tuesday, so the only possibility for the morning reports on Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday is Irving, Lenore, and Nina.
full_output:
<think>Kyle giving the afternoon report on Tuesday means that Nina and Robert cannot give an afternoon report. If Nina gives a report, Helen and Irving must both give reports on the next day. George can only give a report on Tuesday, so the only possibility for the morning reports on Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday is Irving, Lenore, and Nina. </think>
<ans>C</ans>
